newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Dhaka stocks seen mixed after holiday.
newsitem.headline: Dhaka stocks seen mixed after holiday.

text.p: Shares on the Dhaka Stock Exchange (DSE) are seen mixed when the market reopens after the Moslem Friday weekend, brokers said.

"Investors are still cautious. They may book profit on some shares which gained during the rally in last four sessions. But scrips which faced deep correction in recent weeks may continue to attract buyers," said broker Khurshid Alam. The DSE all-share price index rose 55.31 points, or 2.3 percent, to 2,450.56 on Thursday.
